concept.title: Task Topics
concept.shortdesc: Task topics explain how to accomplish specific goals through step-by-step procedures.

section.p: Task topics guide users through a specific procedure. The goal and reason for performing the steps must be clear. For example, tasks can describe how to configure a system or device, how to achieve a business goal, or how to complete a routine procedure.

section.title: User Intent
section.p: "I need to complete a task and understand how to do this."

ul.li: <title>: Task to be performed (e.g., "Reset Your Password").
<shortdesc>: Precise summary of the goal and when to perform the task.
<prereq>: Any prerequisites to be met before performing the task.
<context>: Additional background information about performing the task.
One action per numbered step (max. 10 steps).
Use imperative voice (for example, "Save your data.").
Include expected results for complex steps.
Provide specific UI element names but remember that the UI can change.
Use conditional steps for different scenarios.
Test task topics with actual users to identify gaps and ensure clarity.

section.title: Sample XML Code
section.codeblock: <task id="resetpassword"> <title>Reset Your Password</title> <shortdesc>This procedure resets your account password using email verification.</shortdesc> <taskbody> <steps> <step>Go to the login page and click "Forgot Password".</step> <step>Enter your registered email address.</step> <step>Follow the link sent to your email to set a new password.</step> </steps> <result>Your password is now updated and you can log in.</result> </taskbody> </task>
